title: Great Service
text: The service was exceptional and the food was very good. Generally higher end pub food, the brussel sprouts and fries are really good and they do have some vegetarian options. Valet Parking is mandatory. Their drinks are excellent but they could have a few more beer.

title: The service was helpful and
text: The service was helpful and friendly and the delivery was reasonably quick. The pizza was good as were the wings. The ingredients were fresh and the quality of the pizza and ingredients very good. I will definitely order from the again.

title: Great Service Reasonable Prices
text: A nice rustic ambiance with a friendly staff who are very COVID aware, and the prices reasonable. There is a parking but it can get full quickly. The food varied from average to very good. I didn’t not care for the eggplant parmigiana, (a dish for me that separates the great Italian restaurant from the average) that being said many of the appetizers were very good and many of the other dishes good. I would definitely visit them again.

title: Delicious Pizza
text: They have a small area where you can eat your pizza in the restaurant, however better for takeout. I usually am not the biggest fan of a thin crust pizza but this is an exception. Their pizza is excellent and may be one of the best pizzas we have had in a while. The sauce was good, the toppings delicious. There online ordering is easy to use and communication helpful and timely. I will definitely order from them again.

title: Not bad pizza
text: Their menu is creative and has lots of options like a Portuguese Pizza. We aren’t far away but the food was cold when it got here. The wings were more like Turkey wings than chicken wings, the skin was crispy but the wings were tough and the honey mustard sauce kind of bland. The crust on the pizza was chewy, all in all despite having to microwave everything the food wasn’t bad. I would not rush to order from them again but they are worth a try.

title: Great Fish and Chips
text: Drove from VAB to Yorktown to try what were supposed to be the best fish and chips in Virginia. I don’t know if they are the best fish and chips in the state but they are very good. The portions are generous, and the prices reasonable. They have the choice between haddock and cod, I prefer the haddock. They give you a nice tartar sauce, malt vinegar and ketchup. A hole in the wall but worth a visit. They are also allergy aware and cook the fish separately from their shellfish.

title: A small part of what you need to see
text: The fort itself is not as important as the history behind it. The trail and historical markers are worth seeing the history itself is incredible. The fort itself is a small part of the overall experience, worth seeing but you need to take it all in including the obelisk marking where the fort originally stood.

title: A Beautiful Historic Hotel
text:
The hotel is named for Light Horse Harry Lee, revolutionary war general and father of Robert E. Lee. Reservations and check in are on line and you get a door code a day or two before you check in. There is ample parking behind the hotel. There are two sections to the hotel an older section built in the 1700’s and keep in mind that there are limits to why you can do to renovate as a result. The other side is newer and maybe a better choice for some, as tthey are newer, the bathrooms are nicer and they have their own thermostats. The historic side the thermostat is in the hall. The fire hall is not an issue as they don’t ring the siren after a certain time at night, but the road noise if you are on the Washington Street side can be loud. The bed is large and very comfortable.
Breakfast is included and may be the best hotel breakfast I have ever had. The chef in the morning Meaghan is very friendly and offers a lot of helpful suggestions. We felt COVID safe in the hotel and had no issues, there are a few things they could do to be a 5 star. A guide on how to operate the TV would help, if there is one we could not find it. The blind in our bathroom was broken and taped up, (replace it) the chandelier in the room was covered in cobwebs and needs dusting and the toilet has cobwebs in it too.
The hotel is well located and walking distance to Kelley’s Farm Kitchen and Hamilton’s Tavern.
I would definitely stay here again and recommend it.

title: Great Beer
text:
Park in the train station parking lot and walk up the stairs. They will not let you in because of COVID but there is seating on the patio they do take out. It can be cold and windy on the patio but they have heaters. The service is very good, the staff friendly and helpful. Their beer selection is exceptional and they are the best beer bar in Harpers Ferry. The food is good and the portions generous, a few more vegetarian options would be nice, I’m not a big portobello burger fan. As the chairs on the patio are metal and cold when it is cold if there is a COVID safe cushion it would be nice.
The condiments in a bowl would also be better than on the table.

title: Only BarBQ in the Area
text: The service is good and the staff friendly, the ribs were very good, I didn’t try the pastrami but the brisket was only ok, the bread was stale, Texas Toast style white bread, it was somewhat average. The coleslaw was ok, the potato salad good. I would go back again but I was expecting more.

title: Nice Ambiance Great Product
text: They have a very nice ambiance, with very helpful staff who are cognizant of social distancing rules. They have a nice selection and make a high quality product worth a visit if you are in the area.

title: Great Beer
text: I’m a fan boy of their beer, there is a lot of parking nearby but it is not well marked out. Their beer is amazing and there is a lot of space, it is an industrial ambiance like Reaver Beach in VAB, in fact they are quite similar. The music is not too loud which is a good thing as metal can get annoying after awhile. Definitely worth a visit if you’re in the area.

title: So many options
text: The NPS does a great job and there are some many options in the park, hike, walk, meander or take in all of the history. They have done a great job of both preserving it and making it accessible.

title: Beer and Wine
text: Both a winery and a brewery, the beers are decent but I didn’t think much of the wine. To be fair I have had very few Virginia wines that I like. The service is good and staff friendly, they play great music and there are a lot of places to sit indoors by the fireplace or outside on the patio. The view from the patio is great. Definitely worth a visit.

title: Spectacular facility and view
text: The ground, the facility and the view are amazing. You can be a tasting flight, glass or bottle of wine. The staff are friendly and you can buy a packaged cheese plate,(a few more details on what it’s in it would be nice or a charcuterie package) the wines are ok. Well worth a visit.

title: A hidden gem
text: Mainly middle eastern food, with some burgers and burrito bowls. The portions are generous, the falafel wrap is very good with a little melted cheddar on top as a nice touch. The staff are friendly and the service is good. It can get packed but they also have out door seating.

title: A very pleasant place to visit
text: They have lots of outdoor seating, the winery is owned by women, and run by women. You can buy a flight, by the glass and by the bottle. A great place to visit.

title: A Great Place for Dinner
text: There is parking in back and parking on the street, one thing that would have been nice to know before we got there is that they are bring your own for wine and beer, there is no mention of this on their website. They do not have a freezer or microwave so everything is farm to table. The service is good and the plating exceptional. The food is very good and the portions appropriate. The chef has a bit of a sweet tooth and some of the dishes were on the sweet side but had some savory elements to them. A pet peeve, especially in a fine dining restaurant is when they don’t change the cutlery between courses. The pace of service is a little between rushed and leisurely it could be a bit slower. All in all a very good restaurant and I would go back if in the area.

title: Good Tunes and a Good Place to Hang Out
text: The decor is rustic, there is ample seating both inside and outside. They only serve bar snacks but you can order in from Kelley’s Farm Kitchen. The beer selection is limited and mainly Budweiser products. Ample parking an a good place to chill.

title: Great food great service
text: The couple that owns it are very friendly and helpful, the food is excellent and the portions very generous. They will deliver to the Barn If you want. The seating is out door at the present, they do support take away if you don’t want to eat there. Well worth the visit.

title: A Great Locals Spot
text: I have had breakfast several times at Commune but have never been there for lunch. The service was good and they have seating both inside and outside. The food is a mix of breakfast and lunch items, it is a little surprising but there are only a few vegetarian options. The food is very good made with fresh ingredients, the portions are appropriate and the prices reasonable. Parking can be a challenge.

title: A Great Vegan Oasis
text: A great spot for a quick vegetarian/vegan meal, the food is freshly prepared and there are some creative options. My food was excellent, fresh and lots of flavor, my wife felt hers was good but very flavorful. There are tables both inside and outside. They are across from Baladi’s and the Cupcake Bakery. A few little things would have made it a 5, the tortilla chips that came with meal were stale and if you are going to serve tortilla chips then some salsa or guacamole would be welcomed. The service is good and there is plenty of parking. I would definitely go back but wouldn’t make a special trip to eat there.

title: Great Spot for a Casual Meal
text: You order at the window and then can either take your food to go or eat at one of the picnic tables. The service is good and they are licensed and serve, beer, wine and cocktails. My sandwich was delicious, a great blend or flavors, fresh bread and generous portions. A great spot for a quick bite after a day at the beach or for a casual meal. I liked their food and would definitely try them again.

title: Organized Confusion
text:
In all fairness I have eaten at Mod many times before and the food was ok. Last night because of the power outages they were incredibly busy.
Nothing irritates me more in a service establishment than being ignored, I stood waiting to place my order for almost 10 minutes and was ignored, the young man was busy preparing orders but it would have taken 10 seconds to say I will be with you ASAP I need to work on these orders. The food was also disappointing, I ordered two of the Dillon James Pizzas and they were supposed to have basil on them neither did, on one it tasted like they subbed cilantro for basil. If you are going to sub, you need to let me know, what if I was allergic to cilantro.
One pizza had a Mod (thin crust) and it was like eating burnt pita chips too crunchy and burnt. The food was not great, and the service a hot mess. Unusual circumstances but they did not handle them well.

title: Dealing well with pandemic and great food
text: Very impressed with how they are managing the pandemic. Must wear a mask to enter, they will take your temperature and the tables well spread out and fans ventilating the patio. The service is excellent and the food incredible. The menu is a prix fixe with a lot of choices, every thing was delicious and the portions appropriate. There is a 20% service charge that gets shared with the staff you can of course add more if you wish. I felt safe and would not hesitate to go back.

title: Generous Portions, and the
text: Generous Portions, and the food was good but not exceptional, it will be nice when they are open again as they have a great selection of beer. A hole in the wall but worth going to.

title: Generous Portions Good Value
text: There is ample parking in the front with extra parking in the back. At 8:45 on a Saturday the wait was 10 minutes. This is not a gourmet breakfast and not as upscale as the Bee and The Biscuit (or Chez Cora’s for the visitors from the North) but you have a lot of options and the portions are generous (you won’t leave hungry). They do put a ton of butter on the toast so ask for it unbuttered as there is butter on the table. The service was good and the food decent, the coffee was hot a bit on the weak side but fine. The biscuits were generous and fluffy and tasted good.

title: A Good spot for lunch.
text: A Good spot for lunch. The portions are generous and the calories are posted. You can go with a bowl or pita, the pitas are fresh. The food is good, the falafels are not that great but not horrible. The meals all in are decent, I will definitely go back. They are partnered with a delivery service so you can get delivery. You can eat in or take out. The ambiance for eat in is somewhat spartan.

title: Great Place To Shop
text: We regularly visit the shops at Hilltop, there are some great and unique stores there. There are two excellent men’s clothing stores, Savor The Olive is a great place for olive oil and balsamic vinegar. Tintos is a wonderful spot to relax and taste some wine and cheese and of course buy wine. Bottle Craft is a small craft beer store with a good selection and there are some excellent restaurants for lunch and dinner.

title: Well Worth A Visit
text: The food is incredible and the service is very good. I would definitely recommend the bread salad it is delicious with sprigs of fresh Rosemary, and the wines are moderately priced. One of the best restaurants I have been to in a while. They are small (in the summer they have a patio) reservations are a must and I recommend about 2 weeks out. They have a nice ambiance with a buzz of conversation but not excessively loud. In the winter if you have a table near the door or at the bar it can get cold when the door opens. Street parking nearby can be a challenge, I recommend parking at MacArthur Center, it is a 2 minute walk, they are open 24/7 and 5 hours parking will cost you about $3.00, worth it to avoid the aggravation of street parking. Park on the South Side.

title: On time and comfortable
text: Their seats are more comfortable than their US counterparts and their Premium Economy crushes the US equivalents. The food and wine are not as good as one would expect. They are also not as present in the cabin as their US counterparts. Their for meal service and maybe once after, but not much else. The in-flight entertainment system is lacking the movie selection was really out of date. All in al though a very good air line.

title: Free Shuttle
text:
The hotel is a little bit from downtown but the hotel offers a free shuttle and pickup. The staff are helpful and friendly. The rooftop bar is great and the lobby bar decent. The gym is too hot, however is reasonably well equipped but could use more weights.
The buffets get boring quickly but there are some places nearby. The rooms are clean, well maintained and well appointed.
All in all a great place to stay. They offer concierge services but don’t have a gold key concierge.

title: Great food Tapas Style
text: They have a large space with indoor and outdoor seating. The ambiance is dated, they have an old olive tree in the front seating area. The staff are friendly, the food is served tapas style, and is meant for several people to consume. The souvlakia is just skewers for example, not skewers plus sides. The food is quite good and the prices reasonable. I recommend you have the donuts served with fresh fruit for dessert.

title: Spectacular View
text: A beautiful drive along the coast from Athens to Sounion. You can see the temple of Poseidon on the cliff from a long way off. The temple itself is gorgeous and you can get quite close to it. There are great walking paths on the property that you can explore the views and see the temple from different vantage points. It is windy at the top of the cliff and it can be several degrees cooler than on the shore. The paths are gorgeous but the climb back up can be a bit steep. Well worth the drive and some of the private tours are a better way to go. Sunset at the temple would be gorgeous. The entrance fee is €5.

title: Christmas On Steroids
text: The decorations and ambiance are unbelievable it is like Christmas on Steroids, like the set from a Hallmark Santa Movie. The tables are jammed in and it is a little cramped. The service is good however the coffee is overpriced and just OK. However it is worth a stop and an expensive coffee, just to experience it.

title: A great spot to meander
text: Great neighborhoods with lots of unique and interesting spots. You just want take your time and explore. Stop for a coffee, buy some fruit or just wander aimlessly.

title: A Great Find
text: Wandered in by accident, they were a great find, very helpful, good service and the food is delicious. The prices are also very reasonable my falafel and water were less than €4. One of the best falafels I have had in a while. Well worth going to. They are small but have seating or you can get it to go.

title: Worth a Visit
text: The entrance fee as it is off season is only €4. You can also buy a 5 day package that gets you into multiple sites for €30. It is worth the €4 to walk around construction on the temple started in 450BC. It is kind of cool to walk over land that Socrates might have walked on. It doesn’t take you long to see the site.

title: Part of the Acropolis
text: Not sure why this is listed as a separate site as it is part of the acropolis. The Parthenon is by far the most impressive of the buildings on the acropolis. A guided tour isn’t necessary as they have signs all around that give you great information in Greek and English. A guide would fill in a few blanks but is not in my opinion essential.

title: Well worth it
text: The views from the top are impressive and walking around this ancient site is humbling. The buildings are incredible as is their history. A couple of points to consider the rocks are uneven and can be very slippery so be careful and pay attention to where you are walking. It can also be very windy and a few degrees cooler at the top. You would be wrong to miss the opportunity to visit.

title: A small but beautiful museum
text: The museum is raised above some ruins from the Roman times that they are still excavating. There are just 3 floors to the museum and you can see most of it in a little over an hour. The second floor is the most impressive and the third floor has an auditorium with a video that is worth seeing.

title: Great View
text: You have to take a funicular to get to the restaurant on top of Mt Lycabettus. The view is impressive and the service is good. The food is decent but not exceptional. It is worth going at least once for the view.

title: A spectacular view with great
text: A spectacular view with great service and great food. The food is pan Asian and while they only have a few vegetarian options will gladly accommodate you. Some of the dishes are spicy but not overly spicy.

title: Good Fish Tacos
text: There is ample parking and Pelon’s is usually busy. It is best if you know what to order before you get to the counter. They give you a number and will bring it to your table. The delivery is slower than expected. The food is good and I would definitely go again.

title: Great Stadium and Great Team
text: We went to a Hurricanes game. They have a great atmosphere and passionate fans. It can take a long time to park or get to access to the rideshare drop off. There is no public transportation to the stadium and the wait for rideshare pick up can be 20 minutes. You also can bring a purse or bag into the arena, you have to check it or bring your stuff in a clear plastic bag. The concession prices aren’t too bad and the seats are reasonably comfortable.

title: Location, Location, Location
text: The staff are very friendly and helpful, the parking is easily accessible with large spots and easy access to the elevator. The view from the restaurant upstairs is excellent. The property is well located and a short walk to many restaurants and museums. The hotel is older but the rooms are clean, well maintained and well appointed. It is easy to access from the highways and parking is reasonable. They don’t have valet parking but you don’t need it. The only downside is at peak times you can wait a minute for the elevators.

title: Great Food
text: The food was delicious and the service was good. The prices are reasonable and the food is delivered rather quickly. The pasta is fresh and homemade and the sauces not over powering. The serving sizes are appropriate.

title: Amazing Rooftop Patio
text: The ambiance is great with a beautiful rooftop patio. The service is excellent and the food was very good. Well worth a visit if you are in the area.

title: Great service and great food
text: I recommend the valet parking, it is easier but pricier. The restaurant is on the second floor and reservations are a must. Our server Jazlyn was slammed, she had a private room and a section and it seemed as if the whole section was seated at the same time, despite that she kept her cool, was pleasant and provided excellent service. The food was delicious with lots of options for different diets including vegetarian. Worth a drive from VAB.

title: Excellent Food
text: Quite possibly the best Turkish food I have had. The service was varied from good to great. Our waiter was excellent but when it got busy and he had to pick up extra tables his helper was at best good. The presentation was good and suggestions helpful. I would definitely go back.

title: Simply Amazing
text: One of the best meals I have ever had in Austria, the food was incredible and the service excellent. They also have a great selection of wines, and a very nice ambiance. Reservations are a must.

title: Great Fish
text: A great fish restaurant with lots of choices and well cooked fish. The service was excellent and fun and the prices reasonable.

title: A great place for beer. They
text: A great place for beer. They have a good selection of beer both on tap and in bottles with a decent food and decent service.

title: The service was adequate,
text: The service was adequate, I felt like I was being ignored for a while. The food was good but the prices are high. Order the beer as it is a better value, it was the smallest glass of wine I’ve had in a restaurant.

title: A good airline until there’s a problem
text:
Flight DL 84 from Atlanta to Paris on November 15th was a Charlie Foxtrot. The flight was delayed by more than 3 hours. They couldn’t get the Auxiliary Power Unit to connect properly to the air craft. Stuff happens however the communication from Delta’s gate crew was less than ideal. They did not notify us of a delay until after the boarding time had come and gone, they started out with a 20 minute delay, then it was 15 more minutes, then 15 more minutes, etc., the app and flight tracker were a better source of information. When they finally got it working, we had to wait for the aircraft to warm up. Then we boarded and someone was sick all over the seats, needless to say the cleaning crew had to come on, however at no time did they tell us why we were delayed. They didn’t say anything until the cleaning crew were finished.
When we landed they had boarding passes for some of the delayed passengers but not all of the delayed passengers, so some of us had to get in line with Air France to get our boarding passes. They did give us a coupon for 15 Euros for food.
The communication from Delta left a lot to be desired. By time I arrive at my final destination I will have been traveling for 24 hrs.
Stuff happens and sometimes it is beyond the control of the airline, what separates the good from the bad is how they handle it. This brought back memories of why I had stopped flying Delta years ago. I started with Delta again because they are better than American and marginally better than United, however the way they handled this leaves me questioning that decision.

title: Incredible Views
text: The views from the sky deck are incredible, it is worth doing just to see what a magnificent city Chicago is.

title: A Historic Landmark
text: The hotel is well situated, check in was a bit slow and the bathroom in my room needs a little TLC but those would be my only complaints. The rooms are small but comfortable and well appointed. The hallways are like a museum with pictures of all the stars that played the Empire Room. The ceiling in the bar area off the lobby is amazing. A great hotel to stay in, if you want a sense of Chicago’s history. They also have a shoe shine stand at street level with a wonderful gentleman who gives a great shoe shine.

title: A Chicago Institution
text: Not the healthiest meal you will eat but the prices are reasonable and the food is great. They have more than just hot dogs, try the Italian Beef. They are always busy but the line goes quickly and the food comes quickly.

title: Great Place for Steak
text: Our waiter James helped to make the evening perfect. The food was delicious, the service incredible and ambiance fantastic, it has been years since I last went to Ditka’s and it was every bit as good as I remembered.

title: Good Food and Service
text: The food is good and the service is good, a little bit pricey but in line with most hotels. I can say that anything was exceptional but it was good.

title: The service is impressive
text: The service is impressive and the food even more so. The pasta is fresh and homemade, the sauces delicious, the butternut squash and acorn squash ravioli was among the best I have ever had. I would definitely recommend this restaurant. It was packed but despite this the noise level wasn’t bad. The prices are quite reasonable for Chicago.

title: Good Again
text: Cobalt Grill used to be one of our favorite restaurants then they went down hill for a while. We hadn’t been there for some time but went back recently and it was nice to see that they are back. The service was good and the food excellent, the prices are reasonable and they have a good selection of wines.

title: A great place for wine and cheese
text:
I love the concept here, you can try the wines before you buy them. As many of their wines are from, Spain, Portugal and South Africa, you get great value at a reasonable price.
They also have some amazing cheeses and they occasionally have themed wine dinners. Great store, with a great selection and great service. They have an aged white port that is worth buying as it is an incredible value.

title: A Great Place to Stay
text: Well situated, about a mile from on of the train stations and a short walk to the metro. There are a few good restaurants in walking distance. The staff are friendly and helpful but seem to get flustered when it is busy. The food in the restaurant is decent, the rooftop pool and bar are nice. The rooms are large and comfortable, and fairly quiet. I would definitely stay here again.

title: Great Steak
text: The food was good and the prices very reasonable, the service was good but it did feel a bit rushed. I would strongly recommend a reservation as they fill up quickly.

title: A simple but beautiful church
text: Built as a burial grounds to the Grand Masters of the Order of Christ, it is a simple but beautiful church with a lot of history, surrounded by Olive Trees, and well maintained.
place: Igreja de Santa Maria dos Olivais

title: A beautiful historic church
text: On one side of the main square this church built during the time of the Templars is simple but beautiful inside. You can take photos but no flash.

title: Incredible spot
text: A short boat trip in the river Tagus to the castle. They have done a great job with information on this former Templar site, the views from the ramparts are fantastic. A beautiful spot with great history dating back to the Romans, the Moors and the Templars.

title: A Perfect Tour
text: Our guide Pedro Oliveira was well educated on multiple topics and a wealth of knowledge on Portugal and the Templars. I dragged my wife on this tour but she enjoyed it as much as I did. We were picked up at our hotel and went on one of the best tours we experienced in Portugal. I strongly advise you to book with I Go Portugal.

title: A Must For History Buffs
text: A lot more reasonable to get in than most castles in Portugal and an incredible spot, the history is amazing and you can take pictures inside but no flash. It also nowhere near as crowded as Sintra. The entry fee is 6 Euros per person.

title: Good Service, Good Views
text: The view of the town, the river and the medieval bridge are very nice. The service in the restaurant is friendly and efficient, the food is decent and the portions generous, even the half portions and they have half bottles of wine. They do not accept credit cards.

title: Great Spot
text: They have good beer, great ambiance and very helpful and friendly staff. They have another brewery up the road as well. The names of their beer are incredibly creative based on bands or musicians. Dois Corvos might have better beer but MUSA wins on all other accounts and their beer is good too.

title: Good Beer
text: It is around the corner from MUSA and opens earlier. The food is decent and the beer very good but the service is not the friendliest and the ambiance OK at best.

title: Great Pastries
text: They have an impressive selection of fresh baked breads and pastries. The Pasteis da Nata are good, the coffee strong. You order at the counter and pay after. You have the option of sitting inside or outside. The outside patio is well shaded by trees and umbrellas. Worth a visit especially if you have a sweet tooth.
place: Acucar & Canela Pastelaria, Padaria and Restaurant

title: An interesting spot
text: A little confusing as it is both a snack bar and a restaurant. The menu is an eclectic mix of Asian cuisines, with burgers thrown in to the mix. The service is very good, as is the food, and it is very reasonably priced. The restaurant is very popular and reservations are not a bad idea as it’s incredibly busy at peak times. They also have tables outside.

title: Nice Cafe
text: A nice little hipster cafe, decent food and great coffee, you can get a real flat white here. Seems like a student hang out. The coffee is one of the best I’ve had in Lisbon.

title: Cool Restaurants
text: Not so sure what makes this neighborhood special either. There are some very nice local restaurants and Cork and Company is a great spot to buy authentic cork goods. Fun to walk around.

title: Great View
text: Not sure what makes this neighborhood so special from all of the others. The view however from the top at the little park is amazing.

title: Great Place for Lunch
text: A cool place to walk around or by flowers and produce. The middle are is a great place for lunch with a slew of restaurants. Not worth a special trip unless you need produce etc., but worth a visit if you’re in the area and just outside the metro station at the lower end of the green line.

title: Perfect Ice Cream
text: A small shop with a nice selection of gelato, two small scoops on a cone for 3 Euros. The flavors are incredible and they are not too sweet and they are the perfect size. The staff speak English and were helpful, I’m glad we stopped in.
